title: Monte-Carlo final moved up three hours, due to rain threat
description: The Rolex Monte-Carlo Masters final will take place Sunday at 12 p.m. local time, three hours earlier than originally scheduled, due to a threat of heavy rain. The tournament made the decision Friday in consultation with ATP officials. The four players remaining in the ATP Masters 1000 draw are all vying for their first Monte-Carlo trophy. Second seed Carlos Alcaraz faces 2022 finalist Alejandro Davidovich Fokina in the semi-finals. Alex de Minaur, seventh in the PIF ATP Live Rankings, meets 13th seed Lorenzo Musetti, their third Lexus ATP Head2Head clash. Sunday’s doubles final is now scheduled to start after the singles final. html:
Monte-Carlo

Alcaraz, Davidovich Fokina, De Minaur, Musetti remain in singles draw

April 11, 2025

Corinne Dubreuil/ATP Tour

The Rolex Monte-Carlo Masters will crown a new champion Sunday. By ATP Staff

The Rolex Monte-Carlo Masters final will take place Sunday at 12 p.m. local time, three hours earlier than originally scheduled, due to a threat of heavy rain. The tournament made the decision Friday in consultation with ATP officials.

The four players remaining in the ATP Masters 1000 draw are all vying for their first Monte-Carlo trophy. Second seed Carlos Alcaraz faces 2022 finalist Alejandro Davidovich Fokina in the semi-finals. Alex de Minaur, seventh in the PIF ATP Live Rankings, meets 13th seed Lorenzo Musetti, their third Lexus ATP Head2Head clash.

Sunday’s doubles final is now scheduled to start after the singles final.

Read more from Monte-Carlo:
Alcaraz defeats Fils in Monte-Carlo thriller
De Minaur dishes Dimitrov double bagel
Musetti topples Tsitsipas for first time, reaches maiden Masters 1000 SF
Tsitsipas: 'I was playing with just one serve'
